subject: Testing all
msgSnippet: Hi all, I have written the following class to execute all my tests (only a few since we re just starting). I copied most of it from some example. It does not
messageBody:
Hi all,

I have written the following class to execute all my tests (only a few since
we're just starting). I copied most of it from some example. It does not
really work, however. If I include the constructor I get the error that
there are no tests in AllTest. When I exclude the constructor I get the
error that the class has no public constructor. Is there anyone that can
shed a light on this problem.

thanx and greetz,
Patrick.


import junit.framework.*;

public class AllTests {

public AllTests(String testname){
//super(testname);
}

public static void main(String args[]){
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}

public static Test suite(){
TestSuite t_suite= new TestSuite("All User tests");
t_suite.addTest( UserServletTests.suite());
t_suite.addTest( new TestSuite(UserServletTests.class));
t_suite.addTest( UserTests.suite());
t_suite.addTest( TestUserLogon.suite());
t_suite.addTest( RegisterTest.suite());
t_suite.addTest( junit.tests.AllTests.suite());
return t_suite;
}
}
